intro: Larnax purpureocarpa, commonly known as the purple-fruited larnax, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheat and sorrel. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and lance-shaped leaves with a reddish hue. Its most distinctive feature is the clusters of small, purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The fruit is a small, round capsule that turns reddish-purple as it matures, giving the plant its common name.
